text: And in the darkness, a TICKING sound is heard. Soft and steady -- soothing -- and then a BANG!

A HAND punching a CARD into the huge, ticking TIME CLOCK the wall: 7:00 a.m. PULL BACK TO REVEAL - A bleary-eyed MALE NURSE beginning his day. Alone inside a small wood and glass cubicle, he rips off yesterday's day-at-a-time calendar page, reveali today's date: October 11, 1931. Goes to the Victrola inside the cubicle. Cranks the turnt up to speed. Puts the huge needle down on a spinning 78: hear the song crackling through the empty halls of the hospital -- depression-era Muzak: Horace Heidt & His Musi Knight's "Keep Your Sunny Side Up" The Nurse sharpens the last of a half-dozen pencils to ne points, sits down at his desk, and begins the tedium of jotting entries into a tall stack of Patient Records. Beat. And then he hears a soft, almost paw-like tapping o the glass. He looks up: a PATIENT with a heavily bandaged head is standing there, his eyes as dull and lifeless as marbles. The Nurse waves the Patient away. Goes back to his work. Beat. And then the tapping is heard again. The Nurse snap his head up, about to bark at the man -- but the words st dead on his tongue: Standing on the other side of the glass are now two dozen patients. Likewise bandaged, staring silent and dead-eyed him. Unnerved, the Nurse's finger slowly stretches towards a buzzer-button just below the desk-top. It never makes it. Because -- A HAND - lashes into frame and grabs the Nurse's fingers. Nurse looks up. In addition to the mass of Patients outside the cubicle, there are now six of them inside it, surrounding him. The Nurse's eyes shoot to the still-locked doors of the cubic and he utters one confused word --

-- how -- ? -- and then someone rams all six of his needle-sharp penc eraser-deep into his throat. The Nurse gurgles and staggers -- falls back against the Victrola, hitting the turntable crank as he goes down, causing it to start spinning like a pinwheel. "Keep Your Sunny Side Up" now blares through the halls tr time, sounding like a thousand manic chipmunks. And to th beat of that tune, the Patients smash the CONTROL PANEL inside the cubicle until it shorts-out and explodes! Whic pops open

- and sends dozens more wild, raving Humans rampaging thr the hospital, while EVERY ELECTRIC LIGHT in the place str maniacally, and ORDERLIES & OTHER NURSES are chased down rabbits by Patients and beaten to pulp, and

- filled with devices that look straight out of the Spani Inquisition are trashed to toothpicks, and some of the ST are forced into devices and tortured as PATIENT RECORDS a spindled and ignited -- flaming torches used to set everything in the place ablaze, and A WOLFPACK OF PATIENT kamikaze down-
-- fling open a set of double doors marked "Cerebral Hygiene," shouting: "Vannacutt!" And we see --

-- two people in surgical scrubs: the moustached Doctor named VANNACUTT and a FEMALE NURSE wielding a 16mm camera the two whip around, startled by the shouts, we see the object of their ministrations: A PATIENT on a gurney bein filmed as his internal organs are slowly and methodically extracted -- while still alive. And then all hell breaks loose as the WOLF PACK descends: DR. VANNACUTT manages to yank down a LEVER on the wall labeled "Lockdown" before he's swallowed by the Mob; From somewhere in the house, we hear heavy gear, cables a doors loudly shutting down the house. The NURSE is clubbed to the floor with her own camera. An amidst all the vengeful shouts and wails, a curious thing happens: As one of the Patients picks up the Nurse's blood-spatter camera and puts it to his eye, the image on screen abrupt

-- and dead silence -- and we find ourselves watching old soundless 16mm footage of what happened next: a blur of scalpels and saws as the Patients viciously vivisect Vannacutt and Nurse, who've been crammed together on that same gurney. The B&W CAMERA PUSHES IN TIGHT on Vannacutt' screaming maw -- and suddenly we hear SOUND AGAIN -- -- but, for some reason, it's not a human cry, but the CROWING OF A ROOSTER -- and when we PULL BACK OUT we see what we're now watching is the Crowing Rooster and four blazing camera lenses that was the logo of the old PATHE NEWSREEL. The stentorian VOICE OF PATHE booms OVER:
October 11, 1931: Los Angeles! Dithering, Bernard Herrmann-like strings swell up.
A WHIPLASH PAN from the ocean to a GRANITE BUILDING high the Pacific Palisades. Smoke and flames shoot from every window and door as Firemen look on helplessly.

A conflagration of Biblical proportions incinerates nearly everything and every one inside what was once Tinsel Town's most celebrated psychiatric facility: The Vannacutt Neuropathic Institute. But the secret this inferno burned free was far more frlghtening than any picture that Hollywood could ever produce!
L.A. Sheriff's and Coroner's Investigators poking through Institute....
-- BODIES manacled to walls; rows of SKULLS riddled with drill-holes; a huge VAT filled with blood
-- a Sanitarium of Slaughter supervised by a surgeon gone mad --
ECU -- a formal PHOTOGRAPH of the man himself, mustache waxed, eyes intense as a mesmerist's, seeming to stare a right through us --
-- Richard Benjamin Vannacutt -- and --
-- suddenly, stepping right through VANNACUTT'S FACE and strolling solemnly towards us in bright video-taped color CHRISTOPHER LEE. He addresses the CAMERA:

-- murdered by his own patients before every one of them perished in the blaze. Ironically, the only humans to escape the conflagration -- -- behind him, we see SILENT NEWSREEL FOOTAGE of five people.
-- three ORDERLIES, two NURSES -- clothes and faces sooty and singed, each coughing up a storm as they're treated a the scene --
-- were five of Vannacutt's equally sadistic Staff, all of whom, until the day they died, insisting that they were only following "Doctor's Orders."
The SCREEN behind him goes black.

But our story doesn't end there. For, some years later, the gutted interior of the Institute was refurbished as a private residence. It has yet to be inhabited. Many say because the spirits of the vile Vannacutt and his Victims still walk the long corridors inside this place now known, simply, as: "The House On Haunted Hill." A sudden SMASH of shrill, discordant HORNS scares us out our skin -- and behind Mr. Lee, an IMAGE is seen again:
...high atop a bluff, swaddled in shadows cast by a full that seems to have one of Vannacutt's eyes piercing down it.
Charming.

head_text.subj: CAMERA PULLS BACK FROM A SMALL WALNUT SHROUDED TELEVISION

text: SET... revealing a savagely beautiful young woman, EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE, sitting like the queen of fucking-England the back of her limousine. She's been watching all this o the 12" TV set inside the limousine, a look of perverse amusement on her face. ON THE TV: Mr. Lee smiles for the CAMERA.
I'm Christopher Lee. More of "Terrifying, But True" in just a moment --
No need, baby. She zaps the TV dead with a button on the armrest.
You just gave me exactly what I needed. She reaches for the phone.

A beeping CELL PHONE is retrieved from a coat pocket, pun to life, and brought up to the lips of STEVEN PRICE - a 30ish bespectacled man. While not handsome in the classical sense, he still exude incredible appeal -- the kind that comes from incredible confidence, more money than God, and the most maniacal imagination in recorded history.
(into phone)
Price. (listens; sarcastic)
Evelyn, how nice... (beat, listens)

Well, that is fascinating -- but I'm gonna have to get back to you -- they're trying to shoot me here. PULL BACK TO REVEAL - Price buttoning the phone dead as a NEWS CREW of two videotapes him: an ENG Cameraman named BENNY and a 20-something Katie Couric wannabe with a microphone in Price's face -- KIRSTEN SAVAGE. They're all standing amidst a sprawling landscape of futuristic-looking buildings and rides: a spanking new th park. We see the great steel arch that bears the place's name:
A New Adventure From Steven Price
Business or pleasure, Mr. Price?
My wife. Where were we?
Your roller coaster that is, quote: "unlike any that has ever come before it."
Absolutely. No cheap thrills. A genuine Journey To The Brink Of Madness. He gestures grandly towards the huge and extremely tall expanse of steel girders and tracks in front of them.
Sorry, but it just looks like a generic roller coaster to me. What's the gimmick? Price beckons them to an elevator at the base of the ride
Ever seen one that starts at the top? 20 stories worth of top?
And then what happens?
(smiles)
I think it's something better experienced then described. The Elevator door whooshes open. He bids them enter.
After you.
The DOORS CLOSE and the elevator starts up. Through small ports in the sides they see the beams of the roller coast superstructure dropping down past them as the cabin rises
Sources have told this reporter that the real reason your Park's opening has been delayed was a near-fatal accident on one of the rides here. Comment?
I wouldn't be opening this place tomorrow if every single thing down to the beheaded Beanie Babies hadn't tested 100% safe. -- he's cut off by a loud GROANING sound like metal under stress.
What the hell was that?
(all confidence)
Growing pains: new steel's gotta bend and stretch a little before finally settling in. Another GROAN. A yelp escapes from Kirsten's mouth.
Don't worry. In the fifteen year history of Price Amusements we've yet to lose a single customer. The GROANING stops. But Kirsten and Benny remain nervous.
First time for everything.
I've designed and built six of these places -- take my word for it, everything's fine.
(nervous)
How long 'til we're out of this thing?

Five, ten seconds, we're almost to the top -- -- the elevator LURCHES to a DEAD STOP. Kirsten and Benny look at each other -- anxiety on overdr Price tries to reassure them, but he's not looking real relaxed anymore, either.
Look: even if, God forbid, something ...unexpected...should happen, there's always the safety cable -- -- and now the cabin is rocking: sharp and nasty spasms t are buffeting them into each other --
-- that does what?
Keeps the cab from just -- -- he sees something out the window --

-- oh, shit -- A loud CRACK! The cabin starts dropping -- fast. All thre them scream. OUT THE WINDOW: we see the SUPERSTRUCTURE of the roller coaster flying by. The sound of cables screeching free of pulleys. Benny's camera is wrenched from his hands and bounces aro the cabin. Kirsten's eyes are crazed with terror.
Do something!
Like what?? This isn't supposed to be happening!! The scenery outside the window is a blur.
OhJesusohChrist! The ground is coming up to meet them; the noise inside th cabin is deafening. Benny starts jumping up and down; Kirsten is pounded to t floor. Price braces himself for impact.
Please! Something! Oh-God!
Maybe if I -- With all his strength, Price throws himself across the ca and stabs an unmarked button on the elevator control pane -- the cabin suddenly stabilizes -- -- the elevator door opens --

-- revealing the cabin to be just where it should be: hig atop the roller coaster, right across from the dock where cars depart. They never fell so much as an inch -- all an illusion. The expression on Price's face has changed to a wicked gr He looks at the two terrified souls on the elevator floor
From here on, it gets really scary. A MAN IN OVERALLS (SCHECTER) stands on the dock, waves th News Crew towards a rear car.
Room for two more. The front car is already full with People strapped in so tight they're immobile.

Price still on the departure dock, punching up a number o his cell phone. In the b.g. we can see the cars containin Kirsten, Benny and the others, zooming at incredible spee on 45 degree banks, upside-down loop-de-loops, the works. with screams of sheer pleasure accompanying.
(into phone)
Alright, Princess: now what were you babbling? He listens for a moment -- then his eyes crimp shut with disgust.
(into phone)

Congratulations: on a scale of one-to- ten, you just hit a 73 on the Perversity Meter. I don't suppose for once we could just celebrate at some nice, quiet little restaurant -- Schecter taps Price on the shoulder.
Houston, I think we may have a problem.
(into phone)
Evelyn, go stir your cauldron or something for a sec. Price turns and watches in the distance as the coaster ca takes a screaming hair pin turn.

Kirsten and Benny in the rear car, wild with delight -- -- until they see the front car derail, snap free from theirs, and go hurtling into mid-air. Screams of panic he from the People in that car as they plummet to their deat Kirsten screams with horror, Benny retches, as their car continues to zip along the track and out of our sight.
Problem where? Looked good to me.
"Dummy 6" keeps losing his arm.
So disengage his Flail Arm Mechanism and just make him a screamer.
Steven!!
(back into phone)
Here, dear -- with a suggestion --
Evelyn is livid, as she listens to Price on the phone:
-- forget it. Last birthday the Manson Family Ranch, the year before that: Jonestown.

Oh. You think this is a request. Well, think again. I'm telling you: "Haunted Hill" is exactly where we're having my party this year. You'll find the guest list on your desk by the time you get back --

CLOSE ON a two-page document with the title "Guest List." It's being turned into spaghettini by a large document shredder. PAN OVER TO - Steven Price typing mile-a-minute on a computer, talking to himself as he inputs his own Guest List.
You want it, Precious, you got it: the party of your very short goddamn life. A tentative DOOR-KNOCK heard O.S. behind him:
Uh, Mr. Price? The Dreamworks people are getting a little...antsy.

Tell 'em I'm right there. He mouses his cursor up to a box marked "SEND", the list disappears, his hard drive starts chugging, and he gets u from his chair and exits. CAMERA remains on the working screen. Beat. And then a SHADOW flashes across the screen for a moment. Another beat. And the sound of clicking computer keys is heard. A "message box" appears on screen: ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO DELETE guestlist.doc? The Cursor clicks on YES. ZAP! A blank screen. And then t keys start clicking again, and we see a new Guest List be typed in. Starting with the name: Ms. Jennifer Jenzen Executive Vice-President of Marketing Paragon Pictures
The name "Ms. Jennifer Jenzen" etched in gold-leaf cursiv the top of a small CHROME AND ONYX-INLAID CUBE.

Gorgeous. PULL BACK - and we see MS. JENZEN -- a rodent-eyed, thin lipped 30-something Exec who only needs "Screaming Bitch" stamped on her forehead to complete the picture. She's sitting staring at the Cube, the elegant paper it came in torn to shreds on her desk.
So what the fuck is it? She's addressing her "assistant," a lovely, but harried- looking young Woman of 19, SARA WOLFE.
I don't know, Ms. Jenzen.
Well, who's the damn thing from?
(shrugs)
Messenger just dropped it off. No return address.
You didn't think to ask?
I was in the middle of --
-- being utterly fucking useless, what else is new. Sara's face flushes with anger, but she keeps her cool.
There's something there on the side -- She's pointing to a small, SILVER CRANK jutting out of on the Cube's sides. A legend is etched beneath it: Rotate Once To Operate
I'm aware of that. Well, she is now, anyway. She twists the crank and a tink music box-like TUNE begins to play: Lennon/ McCartney's "Birthday," but in 3/4 time, like some schizoid Viennese waltz.

It's not my goddamn birth -- -- and she stops herself in mid-word as, suddenly: the to of the Cube pops open like a jack-in-the-box! And, slowly like it's on some mini-hydraulic lift, ANOTHER CUBE, identical to this one, starts to inch up into view -- -- which has its own tiny SILVER CRANK in its side. But etched beneath this one is a warning: Do Not Rotate Under Any Circumstances! Without a nanosecond's hesitation, Jenzen reaches out her hand --
-- I wouldn't -- -- and turns the smaller crank. Beat. Nothing happens.
-- no kidding: that's why you're making ten bucks an hour and I'm -- -- and BANG! A SKELETAL ARM comes FLASHING OUT from the smaller cube and SLASHES HER FINGER with a RAZOR!

Jesus!! -- it's no more than a paper cut, but it's bleeding and i hurts -- and then they both see written on the tiny razor Learn To Follow Instructions! Sara can't help herself -- lets loose a little snort of laughter. Jenzen goes ballistic, smashes the lid shut on Cube.
You think this is fucking funny??
No, no, it's just --
-- well, here's a better one: you're fired.
What?
And here's your goddamn severance! She slams the Cube hard into Sara's hands.

The Cube sits in a wastebasket next to the desk that Sara angrily cleaning out. She's SLAMS her entire blotter into trash -- which hits the Cube's crank and starts the music playing again. Sara, startled, looks over -- and sees: AN ORNATE IVORY-COLORED CARD - begin to ascend from the Cube. It starts with the words: Now Try And Follow These: And then all we see are Sara's wide, growing-wider, eyes she reads the rest.
...wow....WOW! Hey, Ms. Jenzen -- ?
Are you still fucking here?? Sara starts to flush with anger again -- and then stops, small smile coming to her lips as she continues to stare the card.
On my way out. Thanks for the valuable parting gift. She snatches the ivory card and stuffs it in her purse.

Where Sara Wolfe sits, decked out in near-dead-ringers clothes and hair-do as we last saw on Jennifer Jenzen: bl silk suit, stiletco heels and an up-sweep -- holding that same ivory-colored card in her hand: Steven K. Price COMMANDS YOU TO ATTEND
A Very Unique Birthday Celebration For Mrs. Evelyn Stockard-Price
And then the CAMERA WHIPLASH CRANES BACK from Sara and th vehicle in which she's sitting, to reveal the grand vista

which snakes crazily up the Pacific Palisades, the crashi waves of the ocean seen in the background. We see that th vehicle Sara is riding in is the lead car of a MOTORCADE comprised of four '50's vintage HEARSES.
The man's insane. And we whip back towards the source of this voice:
where we see this Man's well-tanned hand holding the same ivory card, which continues: Terror, Humiliation, Perhaps Even
Will Be The Entertainment
Don't get much better than that.
where we see the well-manicured hands of this Woman, her holding an 8mm Camcorder; her right, the same card: With ONE MILLION DOLLARS Paid
To Those That Survive The Entire Night
Terrific: what's the catch?
where we see hands of a Man barely out of his teens, his muscular right hand holding that same card as well: Inside the Walls Of THE HOUSE ON HAUNTED HILL
Suddenly the screech of brakes is heard -- Hearse #4 jolt a halt. The invitation flies from the Young Man's hand an the floor, the rest of its text unread.

We see the reason for the sudden stop of the cortege. An ancient CHRYSLER K CAR is parked clear across the road, barring the entrance to the gate of a razor-wire security fence that encircles the premises. Beat. And then a short slight MAN steps out of the vehicle. In the glare of the Hearses' headlights his features look cadaverous. Between that and the fact he's jittering like a hummingbird on sp he makes a pretty unsettling presence. The Man walks slowly towards the hearses, beckoning the riders out.

This is the end...by car anyway. What with the '94 quake and El Nino, the driveway's been pretty much destroyed. 'Shame. Have to hoof it from here. The well-tanned Man from Hearse #2 steps out: DR. DONALD BLACKBURN -- he could be anywhere from 19 to 90. The only thing that's clear is all the cosmetic surgery he's had m him look like George Hamilton, circa 1962. He asks the obvious:
If you don't mind me asking... Who are you?

Name's Pritchett. Watson Pritchett. I own the house, my father built it. And now I just need to get you into it. So... The Camcorder Woman steps out of Hearse #3: a Jenny Jones clone named MELISSA MARR, 27.
Where's Steven Price and his huge, throbbing checkbook?
Not with you, is he? Well, I'm sure he'll turn up any second now... If you'll just come along... The Muscular Young Man from Hearse #4 steps out: a good- looking specimen named EDDIE MOSES, 23.
I wanna know first: to what do I owe this honor? I mean, I never even heard of this guy.
I'm just the Greeter -- and in that capacity, I now urge you all strongly to -- And then Sara-as-Jenzen regally alights from Hearse #1.
But the million bucks each, that's for real?
(a forced chuckle)

It better be -- he still owes me $25 grand for renting the place for the night! Here, let's get you some illumination so you can make your way safely! He grabs a flashlight from his car and shoves it in Sara' hand.
Just point and walk, sis -- the place is right up -- -- and as if on cue, a battery of magnesium floods sudden light up the night like high noon, revealing the House in its glory.
(startled)

...there. Sitting high atop a bluff over the Pacific, a sprawling grey-stone structure. One-third Eames, to one-third Wrigh to one-third Bauhaus. It might look innocuous in the daylight, but right now it looks like Albert Speer's Playhouse. And underscoring the creepy ambience is MUSIC now blaring from speakers perche atop the gate: Marilyn Manson's screeching Goth-metal cov of "Sweet Dreams (Are Made Of These)".
Nice touch, Pritchett: subtle.
As a tumor.
Wish I could take the credit, but --
-- guess we know where Mr. Price is now.
He must've beaten us all here!
'Less the place really is haunted.
Nonsense! Just bad press. All the deaths that occurred inside -- my own father's included -- all perfectly normal fatal accidents.

You better be wrong. I didn't come all this way for "normal." She starts making her way up the disaster of a driveway. Blackburn and Sara look at each other and shrug. They start likewise walking towards the house. The only o left is Eddie. He stares at the little man.
You're totally full of shit, aren't you?
(brightly)
You'll never know 'til you walk through that door! Eddie dismisses him with a flap of his hand and sprints t catch up with the others. Pritchett yells after him:
You wouldn't consider getting my check and running it back down here? No response. Beat. Pritchett gets out of his car.
Didn't think so. Asshole. He starts jittering his way up the drive.
Cold. Flinty. Two stories high and domed, with a stained glass skylight topping it. Despite their varied states of confusion, the four Guests stop in their tracks as they enter, struck dumb with awe.
...Jesus H. Christ.
So where's the party?
Looks like we're it.
More to the point. Where's our host?

More to the point: what in the name of fuck is that? She's pointing up at the stained glass skylight. It seems depict a Man with dozens of hideous creatures hovering ro his head. And above them all looms a huge something with wings and flaming claws.
More of Price's spook-house bullshit.
Not at all! They turn to see Pritchett's head poking through the door -- putting as little of himself as possible inside the ho proper.

Part of the original structure. When it was still an asylum. Guy who ran the place -- Dr. Vannacutt -- found it "inspirational." From some German cathedral a million years ago: "Driving the Demons From the Mind."
I'm moved beyond words.

The hint of still weirder shit to come, I can only hope. She whips the Camcorder to her eye and starts recording e detail of the skylight. Dr. Blackburn rolls his eyes. Pritchett starts calling loudly:
Mr. Price? Mrs. Price? Somebody? Hello??
Pritchett, take it down a couple hundred decibels, what is your problem?
Problem? No problem -- just want to get my money and get on home -- you know, things to see, people to do? He laughs weakly; starts shouting again:
Mr. Price?? Mrs. Price?? Melissa Marr continues to shoot up a storm of tape in the room, as overexcited as a five-year-old who's lost her Ritalin.

I knew this whole place'd be pure gold! Pritchett, point me in the direction of the goddamn ghosts! If I can get something bizarre enough on tape, I think I can parlay it into getting me some kind'a Robert Stack "Unsolved Most- Wacked-Out Home Videos" gig. No more five afternoons a week of sex-change- Nazis-and-the-lesbos-that-love-'em.
You've got your own TV show?
The guy whose hair I do has his own TV show. All I've got is a blow-dryer and a dream. Sara's staring at something that's making her more nervou the second:
Uh, excuse me -- but does anybody know any logical reason why those little demons would be moving? She's pointing to the skylight.
Where? She whips her camera up at the stained glass. Zooms in. T beat. And then lowers the camera, sighing in disappointme
...birds. Just seagulls or something walking on the glass, goddammit.
Cheer up: before the night's through, I'm sure one of us'll get hacked to pieces by somebody or something.
I may start right now. All heads turn again -- standing in the open front doorwa dressed absolutely to kill is a not-terribly-pleased-look EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE.

Who the fuck are all of you?? -- and right on that beat: the huge dome of STAINED GLASS above them all EXPLODES! All heads whip up -- as time seems to stand still -- and begins raining COLORED SHARDS in the foyer.

Oh...my...God.... IN SLOW MOTION -- We see the rest of the Guests instinctively start to duck and cover against the deluge all except EVELYN who's staring up at the descending projectiles with a profound look of annoyance on her face EDDIE - notices that a huge DEMON-HEADED GLASS SHARD is hurtling, razor-point-down, for Evelyn's head! With an athlete's reflexes, he hurls his body at hers --

-- Jesus, lady! -- -- tackling her to the floor, the giant SHARD missing her skull by literally a hair. It plunges six inches deep int the parquet, THWANGS like an arrow into a target. Beat of absolute sheer STUNNED SILENCE. And then:
Wow. Everyone else stares at Evelyn, who's not moving.
Is she...alright?
I thought she was dead. For sure.
Not even fucking close. (seething; to Eddie)

Get...off...of...me. It's like being spit at by a cobra; Eddie doesn't have to told twice. Leaps off her, and Evelyn slowly, angrily get her feet, a trickle of blood coming down her cheek from a small cut there. A VOICE is heard from somewhere O.S.
Not dead now, but soon. All eyes look up to see: STEVEN PRICE perched on the balc rail above them in formal wear, legs crossed, cigar in ha blowing out smoke through highly bemused lips.
She's been marked for it. The House does that. Happened to Pritchett's father. Likely happen to you all. Isn't that what you told me, Mr. Pritchett?
(looking away)
I can't remember at the moment. Blackburn applies his handkerchief to Evelyn's bleeding cheek. She recoils:
Don't touch me!
I'm impressed: I don't think Evelyn's ever said those words to anything with genitalia.
I'm not laughing, Steven.
You shouldn't be -- you were nearly just killed, sweetheart. (to the guests)
And now that our birthday girl is finally here, let the games begin!
Haven't they already? Price just smiles.
Sure is a funky old house, ain't it? She glares back at him, steaming.
Could we have a word?
Oh, I think we're going to have several. Evelyn doesn't have to be invited, she's already stomping halfway up the stairs. Price smiles down at the Guests:

This'll just take a moment -- you'll find food and booze in the main salon, knock yourselves out. Evelyn grabs him hard by the arm and yanks him back into shadows; they disappear from sight. The Guests just stand there.
So, what? The thing with the glass? Price did that?
I hope not.
Of course he did, for God's sake. (beat)
Didn't he, Mr. Pritchett?
I can't comment until I get paid.
I'm surrounded by idiots. Blackburn walks off into the Main Salon near the Foyer. T others shrug and follow him, except for Pritchett, who sh upstairs:

Mr. Price??? No response from anyone. Pritchett's eyes jitterbug all around him -- he sees he's standing there alone. As nonchalantly as he can, he quick -- steps towards the Sal and the others -- passing right by a barely perceptible black dot in the wall, no larger than a dime --

-- and we PUSH IN on this DOT, until we're inside it, on the OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL and see that's it's connected COAXIAL CABLE, which we FOLLOW past ancient, decaying bea and mortar, past VERMIN -- rodent and insect, both -- tha skitter maniacally right in our faces -- and then right into the innards of the multi-wired CABLE itself -- emerg out near...
-- that's atop a table with several other monitors and a literal Circuit City's worth of electronic and computer equipment, all of it inside a --

-- in which sits Steven Price's engineer SCHECTER, in his coveralls, eating a sandwich, as he mans Haunted House Central Control. He hits a combination of keys on the computer. On one of the Monitors we see a door somewhere inside the House rapidly open-and-shut, open-and-shut. Nods with satisfaction, then YELPS! as he spots a MILLIPE wriggling out of his tuna salad, straight into his mouth.

Jesus! He flicks the insect away, nearly gagging. It lands on another VIDEO MONITOR that is trained on a room on the up floor of the place. Some space that looks like it was goi to be a bedroom, once upon a time: a lot of strange, ultr modern furniture: all of it metal and of bizarre angles a shapes. And then into that room storms Evelyn and Price. PUSH IN on that video screen and suddenly we're there:
As Evelyn slams the door behind her.
I gave you a goddamn guest list two pages long -- where the hell are they?
Shredded. Sorry. Decided to whip up one of my own: a group so hungry for money that they'd be willing to do anything. I thought you'd be more comfortable with your peers.
I guess it was stupid of me not to expect something this twisted from you. Well, congratu-fucking-lations, Steven: Round One, you win.
Well, not quite. See, those people down there: they aren't the ones I invited.
Then who are they?

The SCREAMS of Melissa Marr echo wildly in the room -- lo agonized HOWLS that just grow louder and louder. Everyone looks up in alarm -- with the exception of Evelyn, whose focus is on pouring herself a new drink.

Could be old Melissa found what she was looking for. As the SCREAMS grow even more hideous, Price and Guests d out of the room. Pritchett downs the rest of his huge tum of Scotch, then proceeds very halfheartedly after them -- and then the SCREAMS stop. Pritchett sits back down in hi chair, pours another drink.
She's dead. Chalk up one for the House.
Price and Blackburn striding down a long hallway, eyes darting everywhere, shouting:
Melissa!
Ms. Marr! And then hearing from down in the basement:
Oh, Jesus: down here!
Price and Blackburn arrive to see Eddie and Sara standing outside the door labeled "Cerebral Hygiene."
What?
Is she alright?
....I don't...know. The two men follow their gaze. To the FLOOR. Lying there MARY'S CAMCORDER the lens shattered, the hand-grip broken off.
Something just must've...frightened her, that's all.

Yeah...something. Sara holds up her finger: it's drenched with fresh blood. with it, she points into the empty room. On the tile is a wide, red and glistening DRAG MARK leading from the doorw to the foot of the half-rotted... OPERATING TABLE.
Jesus. Price and Blackburn run into the room. Blackburn kneels d examines the drag mark. Utterly baffled and not a little unnerved:
It just...stops here. Sara sticks her head in the door, nervously:
Maybe....maybe she went up on the table. Price runs a finger along the table bed; he's able to dig trench the entire length of it through the three-inches-d worth of dust.
Nobody, nothing's been on this in...67 years. Eddie stomps into the room, frightened and frustrated, tr to make sense of it all:
Well, she went somewhere! She didn't just up and disappear into thin air!

No...not air -- The three men turn to look at her -- Sara's staring at something above them: a spot on the... CEILING directly o the Operating Table, where the bloody DRAG MARKS resume, continuing all the way to the point where concrete ceilin meets equally solid wall, and then vanish altogether.
-- into the House. They just stare at the sight in dead, scared-shitless silence.
There's gotta be some way out --
Eddie seen haranguing a near-dead drunk Pritchett:
-- of this place, goddamnit, Pritchett!
Yes. Pritchett drains the last drops of his tumbler of Scotch.

Alcoholic coma, if you hurry. He starts to pour another -- -- Eddie swats both glass and bottle out of his hand; the SHATTER on the floor. In this tension-packed room, the so is magnified a hundred-fold. Blackburn all but jumps out his skin.
Jesus H. Christ!
Oh dear.
(to Eddie)
If you don't calm the hell down I'm gonna strap you in for electro-shock!
(waving his pistol)
How you gonna manage that with a new blow-hole in your dome?

Hey, if everybody's gonna kill each other, could you do it in another room? I'm trying to get something accomplished here. We see that Sara's sitting at a desk in the room, fiddlin with the innards of Melissa Marr's camcorder.
What the hell good is fixing that gonna get us?
An answer, I hope: exactly what -- or who -- Melissa was taping.
And then where are we?
Put it this way: if it's your face on that tape, Mr. Moses, we're one gunshot away from solving all our problems --
-- fuck you!

I got it! Something, anyway... The room goes silent -- on the PLAYBACK SCREEN on the sid the CAMCORDER, an erratic, wildly rolling IMAGE can be se Everyone present, Pritchett included, starts gravitating towards Sara and the desk. She hits the STOP button on th Camcorder.
The motor's working, but the tape's pretty much D.O.A. -- I could only rewind it back a couple of feet. Don't blink, this is probably the first and only showing. She punches PLAY. And we see on the

soundless: a vision of free flight -- the lens capturing what it saw as it dropped to the ground: a wild, herky- jerky, ass-over-teakettle melange of -- WALL/CEILING/MARY'S HAIR -- and, finally: FLOOR as the lens smacks TILE, fractures into a starburst of cracks, topples onto its side. And through this veil of JAGGED, SPIDERY LINES, we see: MARY'S HAND drop into frame -- lie still for a moment -- and then start VIOLENTLY SPASMING, as a BLOODSTORM starts spattering it from O.S. Until the color of her flesh can no longer be seen -- A METAL CRUNCH is heard from inside the CAMCORDER, and th image on the screen goes to BLACK.

No one moves -- they're all frozen there, staring at the screen. Beat. And then: the sound of light APPLAUSE is he Heads turn towards its source, and we see: EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE leaning against one of the walls, h hands slowly, almost angrily CLAPPING. She doesn't speak, she seethes:

Game, set and match, Steven. You've outdone yourself. And I know it's not good manners to ask the magician how he did it, but inquiring minds are desperate to know: just what did really happen to Ms. Marr?
Asking the wrong person again.
I mean, did she stage it all for you and then go hide -- or did you just flat out kill the little bitch --
-- I pose you the same question --
-- and who's next on your list?
If I had one, Evelyn, I think you know who'd be first and last --
-- oh, for chrissake, that's a given; we all know that knocking me off is the bottom line here --
-- that wasn't my original plan, but it is starting to look more attractive --
-- thank you! All the cards finally on the goddamn table! She produces one of the Glocks and points it at him.

Just know I'm not gonna make it easy for you. We still don't know the answer to the Million Dollar Question -- -- Evelyn fires the gun into the wall just to the left of Price's head. It smashes a hole there the size of a fist.
Jesus!
Question answered.
They weren't loaded when I put them in there!
Funky little house, ain't it? (turns to the Guests)

Friends, your hostess is now going to retire for what's left of the night. If you need me, I'll be in the bedroom upstairs -- but try and fight that need: the door'll be locked, I'll be trying to sleep, and if anyone so much as breathes in the keyhole, I'm gonna empty this thing into their fucking head. Thank you all for the bestest birthday a girl could have. She walks away and begins climbing the stairs. Price turn the guests to see that every eye in the room is staring a him -- and not without fear. Price is astonished, then ju shakes his head with disgust.
Even if I were inclined, I've had better -- and a lot safer -- opportunities to kill off a wife.
Three times, to be exact.
Excuse me?
Accidents. Fatal. Each of your prior wives, so we've been informed.
Can't imagine by who. I don't suppose the truth would interest you: that I've never had another wife but Evelyn. No response, just looks of confusion.
Married. Once. Same woman. All these years. She just slithered up the stairs.
Prove it.
Prove it how? Sara strides to the coffin-cabinet and withdraws one of t Glocks.
And what are you planning on doing with that? She cocks it.
I just decided a million bucks is worthless if you ain't around to spend it. There is a way out of this place, and I'm gonna either find it or create it. (to Eddie)
Coming or staying? Eddie looks at his options: Price, Blackburn & Pritchett or Sara.
Yeah, what the hell, I'll go.
Yeah, me too. Blackburn takes a gun from the coffin and cocks it.
More the merrier.

No. I'm going back to try and find Ms. Marr. If she's hurt, I'll tend to her. Dead, then I'm coming back for him. He glares at Price and exits in the opposite direction. Long beat. Price stares at the befuddled Pritchett who se to be having a quiet conversation with himself.
I think...I may have the answer.
What?

I remember...it was a long time ago...my father said: when the House was finally completed, make sure...we-christen-it- with-this-bottle-of-dirt-cheap-champagne- that-should-still-be-in a cupboard somewhere! Pritchett is out of his chair extremely fast for someone a near-lethal blood alcohol level. As he makes his exit, grabs one of the last Glocks. Turns sheepishly to Price:
Nothing personal. He chambers a shell and exits. Beat. Price is alone in th room.
Evelyn, goddamnit -- !
-- and bursts through the hinged panel into computer central, shouting:

-- Schecter, how is she pulling this off!? Schecter doesn't turn, all his attention focused on the computer screen, his fingers stopped dead in the their tr upon the keys as though suddenly terrified by something. Price looks at the computer screen. Two words typed there Someone Else
What does that mean? Schecter stays frozen. Price is beside himself:

Schecter, what the hell does it mean?? He whips Schecter around in his swivel chair -- and comes literally face-to-face with -- a Man who no longer has a face! It's like someone took a giant melon-baller to Schecter's head, scooping out everything -- just leaving rind that's the interior wall of his skull. Well, mostly everything: there's still bits of bloody brain pulp hangi from the bone. Needless to say: he's dead. Price turns away, gagging in horror -- and his eye is caught by a flash of motion in a -- VIDEO MONITOR -- the one trained on the Main Salon A FIGURE (VANNACUTT) DRESSED ALL IN WHITE standing by the sideboard, looking up into the CAMERA -- a strange stainless-steel device in his hands that looks half- surgical saw/half-speculum. Something dark and wet drippi from its knife-sharp edges.
Someone else. Not Evelyn -- Price's Eyes jump to --

-- plain as day, there's Evelyn under the covers. Price's eyes dart back to the SALON MONITOR -- the Figure White is no longer there. But Price catches a flash: the to the corridor just swinging shut! Price jumps to his fe and tears-ass out of the small room, screeching:
There's someone else in the House!
Eddie and Sara pulling with all their might on the iron g to one of the windows. Eddie stops.
You hear somebody?
No -- keep pulling, it's moving!
Dr. Blackburn, armed with Sara's flashlight and his medic bag, strides with determination through the labyrinth. Th stops when he hears a faint VOICE in the distance:
Blackburn! Blackburn finds he's stopped right by the door to the "Cerebral Hygiene" room.
(suddenly nervous)
Ms. Marr...?
We see the locks on the door, deadbolt and knob-lock both SNAP OPEN simultaneously. Beat. In the distance, a VOICE:
Someone else -- ! The door SLAMS. WHIP-PAN to Evelyn's bed: clearly it's be slept in -- but now it's completely empty.
Pritchett on his hands and knees going through a large cabinet, tossing books and papers over his shoulder in a frenzy of frustration.
-- in the House!
(to himself)
I know, I know -- it's gotta be here somewhere!
Price tearing down the stairs:
You sonovabitch, where are you, I saw you!!
Eddie and Sara drop their arms from the window, exhausted But there is now a space about two inches wide between IR GRATE and OPEN WINDOW.
We can do it...
Sure, with three days and a blowtorch.
It's a thousand years old -- we just need a crowbar or something to get leverage -- the sucker'll pop!
No prob: I'll just hop down the hardware store --
-- no. The basement -- the room with all the controls to this thing: big long iron levers just lying there --
-- not a chance -- there's too much weirdness down there I don't think even bullets are gonna stop.
You're starting to sound like Pritchett. -- and then the LIGHTS zap to BLACK and Sara SHRIEKS --
-- Pritchett shrieks as the LIGHTS ZAP BACK ON -- blindin then OFF AGAIN -- then ON --
-- the lights in the wall sconces are strobing like an epileptic's worst nightmare. The sheer schizo-psychedelia it all has Dr. Blackburn frozen in his tracks --

-- as is Price. -- then the SOUND starts. Price is first to hear it -- it puts an expression on his face like someone is ramming bo eardrums with icepicks over and over again: A LOUD CRACKLING ELECTRIC SURGE -- on-again, off-again, in direct sync with the dimming of the lights. What makes it so especially unsettling is the noise that accompanies each Sledgehammer Surge: a straining, strangulating CRY. noise like a calf would make as its throat is slit. The light-show be damned, Price leaps down the stairs, sprinting towards the Noise.
-- likewise Dr. Blackburn --
-- likewise Sara and Eddie, running as fast as they can -
Price spies Blackburn at the other end of a Corridor, sho over the Noise to him:
Where is it??
I don't know!! Sara and Eddie appear, spot them; Sara shouts:
What is it??
Something with the power, I don't know!! And then Pritchett is seen at the far end of another Corridor.
It's down there! He's pointing to a long corridor - a light strobes at the end.
What's down there?
(awe-struck)
The...Fourth of July.
What are you babbling, you lunatic?? And then clarity comes to Price's eyes.
Electro-shock.
-- and the Noise suddenly stops. The lights stop pulsing. Pitch dark and dead quiet. Eddie squints and points at something deeper in the room.
There's something -- -- MOVING inside the Room. Blackburn lashes his arm out, stopping anyone from going any further into the room. He whispers:

Don't move, don't make a sound... In the darkness, in the distance, they can make out AN ANIMATE PRESENCE at waist level. Pale. With something flowing from its sides, almost wing-like. And it's squirming, undulating like a snake -- and then, softly this time, that calf-like cry. High-pitched, almost femal sounding. Price ducks under Blackburn's arm and starts walking slow into the room, towards it. No one tries to stop him. ON PRICE as he gets closer, and can see that whatever it is, it's perched atop one of the TABLES -- -- the CRY -- and Price steps closer, and he can make out to the side of the table, something that looks like....a hand? -- the CRY -- closer now: a hand discerned -- human -- wi rings on the fingers, polish on the nails --
...Ms. Marr...? -- no response -- just the CRY -- Price reaches out to touch that hand --
Is it Melissa?? -- a look of horror comes to Price's face:

-- and then lights flash BLINDING WHITE -- and the bug-ey face of EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE is seen -- screaming that C through the RUBBER BITE-DOWN that's been taped tight to h teeth -- -- her head, her torso, her limbs BUCKING like they're je propelled against the leather straps restraining her -- -- as the MASSIVE VOLTS of electricity from the DYNAMO sh wired to punch into her like ten thousand razors at once -- and Price reaches for her instinctively -- -- only to have Blackburn lunge in and yank his hand away

-- are you crazy!?! -- and for a moment all anyone can do is watch as Evelyn gets jolted and slammed again and again and again -- and sparks fly from the electrodes on her head and smoke star to billow --

Turn it off!! Somebody turn the damn thing off!! En masse, the Guests charge into the room, scrabbling everywhere around the DYNAMO, looking for a wire, anythin they can use to stop the current ripping through her body -- and Price is near-insane, smashing buttons, yanking switches off their moorings as he watches the pupils disappear from the eyes of his bucking, jerking wife -- -- and Sara pulls a cord from a socket in the wall and nothing happens -- -- and Blackburn spies something running down the table leg -- -- and Price is literally SCREAMING -- -- and Blackburn yanks the table-leg wire with all his might -- -- and everything stops. The light show. The screaming. T smoke. -- and Evelyn, too. Her body drops back down on the table with a horrible THUD. Her eyes stare sightlessly. Blackbu leans over her. Head to her chest, a finger to her neck. Beat. And then he stands back up straight.
I'm sorry --
-- she's not dead! Just have to get her heart pumping aqain!
Mouth-to-mouth! Price yanks the bite-piece from Evelyn's mouth -- a plume purple ARTERIAL BLOOD spews from her lips and cascades al over her face.
Oh, Jesus....
Adrenaline -- in your bag, Blackburn, you must have --
-- even it we were in the E.R., Price: it's too late -- her heart's burst! Price puts his ear on Evelyn's chest -- listens -- his fa falls.
No... Sara puts two fingers to Evelyn's wrist pulse. Feels.
She's gone. Even Pritchett gets into the act, taking the flashlight a shining it into Evelyn's fixed pupils.
They don't get any deader. Price strokes his wife's hair, tears begin to form in his eyes.
No. With his other hand, Price begins to unbuckle the restrai
I...don't think...anybody should be touching the body.
I think I'll do what I damn well please.
She's right, Price. It's a matter for the police. He takes Price's hands firmly and removes them from Evely

It is in-fucking-deed. At the risk of stating the obvious: this wasn't exactly a goddamn suicide. He smacks the now-loose steel-and-leather restraint with hand -- in the tense silence of the room, the buckle BANG like a GUNSHOT against the table, over and over again.
House 2, Guests 0.
I think, Pritchett, we've got a situation here that even you can't explain away as "ghosts." This is ice- cold homicide by person -- or persons -- He glares furiously at his Guests.
-- not entirely unknown. She cocks her pistol and aims it at Price.
Convenient place to point blame, hon', but this time, the only wrong one: for all I know, somebody should be pointing that gun at you. She shakes her head and keeps the gun where it is.
I was upstairs with Eddie --
-- that's the fact, bud --
-- where the hell were you?
Upstairs, too. Come with me, I'll show you another body, a friend of mine named Schecter --
-- what was he doing here?
Running all the bells and whistles we set up to scare hell out of everybody --
-- the stained glass --
-- yeah, we did that --
-- the window and door grates --
-- no -- that's when everything went ragtime -- whoever else is in this house has been doing everything since -- I thought it was Evelyn --
-- which is why you killed her. And now he takes his pistol and cocks it at Price.
I was upstairs!
I never saw you --
-- I did: down here.
And I think that's case -- -- likewise producing his gun and chambering a shell.
-- closed.
Pritchett, you're not joining this necktie party?
I was upstairs looking for... well, uh... moral support. I don't know what's going on down here, but I like you, and if you say the house didn't kill your wife -- Pritchett fumbles out his pistol.
-- then I guess then it had to be you. Sorry.
Thank God -- I was afraid I'd be lynched without a quorum.
If you've got a gun on you, Price, I'd hand it over now.
Not just yet. Would any of you be interested in knowing exactly why I ended up here in the basement?
Fascinated.
I was chasing after somebody I saw in the salon.
Oh, really: who?
Didn't catch his or her name, just followed them down here. Somebody all in white surgical gown.
(suddenly terrified)
Vannacutt!!
Or somebody wanting me to believe that.
Well, I don't.
Then just wait -- maybe this whoever's got you next on the Asylum's equipment- test list. Maybe a literal mind-blow inside the "Saturation Chamber."
I'll take my chances.
Well, I can't, sweetheart. And now Price produces his gun.
If there really is someone else in this house, I think the four of us can handle the situation.
I think one of you has been part and parcel of making this situation!
The gun, Price; hand it over: now. Price cocks his pistol.
Don't test me, I'm real prepared to use this to stay alive --
-- confirming everything we already know --
-- I'll take the chance, come morning and cops, I'll be proved right -- -- Sara advances --
-- you lose either way, Price --
-- listen to the man --
-- listen to me, goddamnit --
-- no more -- -- she reaches for his gun --
-- no! And Price pulls the trigger right in her face!

Only...there's no explosive report, no whine of bullets - just this CLICK! CLICK! CLICK! from Price's gun. The room freezes for a moment -- wide-eyed shock all arou Price looks down at his Glock: the weld on the clip's bee broken.
Who fucked with my gun?? Freeze broken: Eddie lunges for him.

You sonovabitch!! And he tackles Price to the floor, punching the gun from Price's grasp and nailing him in the face a few times for good measure. Price is down for the count. Pritchett walks towards the stairs. Blackburn looks to Sa
Now what do we do? We've got to hold him somewhere 'til the police --
-- the "Saturation Chamber." Where he wanted to put me. Pritchett stops in his tracks on the stairs, alarmed.
What would drive a madman sane would drive a sane man mad. (pauses)
I need a drink. Anyone wants me, I'll either be upstairs or dismembered.

Price lets out a scream as Eddie SLAMS the door to the "Saturation Chamber". Price's face appears in the small porthole. Sara twists the WHEEL that seals tight the cast-iron, cap shaped device. Asks Blackburn:

Pretty old and rusted out -- you sure this thing'll hold him? Through the single small window on the side, we can see a furious, panicked Price slam his full weight against the inside of the door. It doesn't budge a millimeter.
Don't think it'll be a problem.
(to Eddie)
C'mon. Through the Chamber window, we see Price make another fut CRASH against the door.
Shouldn't somebody like, stand guard or something -- just in case?
I'll stay, if it'll ease your mind.
You sure? You'll be alright by yourself? Blackburn pats the gun in his jacket pocket.

I'm not worried. Sara nods, takes Eddie's hand and disappears up the stair Blackburn and Price stare at each other on opposite sides the tiny window. Price is screeching something at him, bu can't hear a word through all that iron.
Can't quite make that out -- what? Price silently bellows.

You want to see how this thing works? Weird request, but okay... Blackburn leans over and starts twisting dials and flippi every switch he can find on the CONTROL PANEL of the caps We see Price look up in alarm: a CIRCLE OF PULSING LIGHTS dappling down on him. It looks almost quaint: like a Victorian carousel at night.

You've got to let me know how it all turns out. Professional courtesy and all that. And with Price seen yelling and pounding through the wind BLACKBURN walks away and disappears into the dark of the basement. He passes right by the huge, sealed STEEL DOOR where Vannacutt stashed his corpses. The tendrils of mold the metal have expanded to the length of a man's arm.

Price is down on the floor of the capsule, a look both of fear and an engineer's curiosity on his face, as he stare at the CIRCLE OF LIGHT that has begun to spin faster and faster -- -- and then whatever anxiety he has abruptly drops from h face. Aside from a little eye-strain, absolutely nothing' happening to him. He stands and examines the source of th light. Sees on the ceiling of the capsule: it's nothing m than a spinning mirror ball-like apparatus flecked with colored glass. He's unimpressed:
Technology by Fred Flintstone. He turns away from it, braces himself against a wall,

head_text.subj: BEING TORMENTED BY LIGHT, SOUND, FURY AND HALLUCINATIONS.

text: Where we view Price from outside the Capsule. Through its tiny window we see him silently jerk, spasm and scream -- while standing inside the utterly empty Saturation Chambe OVER we hear almost bestial-sounding grunts.
Sara and Eddie move through the corridor - stopping at every junction. They're hopelessly lost.
I think we should have taken a right back there.
Back where? They scan the maze of interconnecting passageways behind them.
Good point.
(pointing to another hallway)
Let's try down here... They move in that direction, turning a corner and passing several doorways. Eddie glances at the door they're about to pass and stops.
Hey, check it out. Sara stops and looks at the wire glass door. A nameplate reads: DR. RICHARD B. VANNACUTT
Vannacutt's office. She tries the door handle. It's unlocked. They move insid slowly.

Inside is an amazing collection of debris, partially ransacked. File cabinets are open and the floor is littered with papers. On shelves are bottles of specimens of body parts and dead sea life, floating in formaldehyde. Sara moves over to Vannacutt's desk and begins going through the drawers. Eddie stares at the specimens.
What are you looking for?
Maybe there are notes or drawings of this place, showing how those plates work. Eddie pulls a picture from the wall... The glass is cracked. Sara looks back at Eddie and moves to him. SARA (cont'd)
What've you got?

Class of 1931. ECU - THE PICTURE shows the various doctors and nurses in resident. The banner above the corroding image states: THE VANNACUTT INSTITUTE STAFF FOR 1931. Below each face i a name and position.
Cheery looking bunch.
Better living through electricity. Sara notices something about the photo.
Holy shit! Now we know how the guest list was made up. Look, these names... Head Nurse, Ruth-Ann Stockard... Bjorn Jensen, Electro Therapy... Jasper Marr, Thomas Steven Price... They're all here!
Wait a minute... What are you saying?
Everyone that was invited is related to one of the staff who was here when the place burned. There are five of us... Suddenly, another voice is heard...
And five that didn't die. Sara and Eddie just about jump out of their skins! Pritchett is standing in the doorway in his usual sloshed condition.
Shit, Pritchett!!!
Price didn't make the guest list... The house did. It wants vengeance.
How's a goddamn building gonna send out invitations?
What's life, anyway? Waves...? Sound...? Light...? Electricity...? I don't know... Phone lines...?
Or an on-line computer.
That's crazy!
What about that other guy?
Schechter? Wrong place at the wrong time... like you. Eddie stares at the photo.
I don't see Blackburn's name on here...
Dr. Blackburn opens the door to the room and walks grimly into it, staring at Evelyn's dead body, still strapped to table.
The late Mrs. Steven Price. From his medical-bag, he removes a scalpel.
Tragic, tortured Mrs. Steven Price. With a blur of quick slashes, he cuts her limbs and torso free of their moldy restraints.
Lovely Mrs. Steven Price. Now accessible, he parts the top of her nightgown. Runs a finger slowwwwly from the tip of her chin down to her bar breasts.

Creamy, cool...and now very cooperative Mrs. Steven Price. His tongue darts from his lips and he begins planting lon lingering kisses all over her neck -- -- FLASH: of a hypodermic being pulled from Blackburn's b -- Blackburn kissing everywhere around her breasts -- -- FLASH: of the air bubbles in the needle being plunged of the tip: squirt! -- -- bubbles of Blackburn's saliva dampening her nipples, h tongue swabbing concentric circles within her aureole -- -- FLASH: the needle into the crook of Evelyn's elbow -- -- Blackburn's mouth dancing down to her belly -- he's be to hyperventilate with excitement -- and A HAND comes languidly into frame, begins stroking his lu dyed locks --
I've missed you.

I've missed this. And Dr. Blackburn tosses the hypo away and hoists himself meet the eager, waiting mouth of the now very alive EVELY STOCKARD-PRICE -- who starts to vigorously respond to Blackburn's touch. He reluctantly pulls himself away.
Easy. You've got to keep still for a bit, the last thing we need is a coronary.
You're the Doctor, sweetheart. 'Guess the atropine worked, then.
Convinced all those that needed convincing: you're an official dead lady.
And what's Steven's status?
Still alive, but it's just a matter of time. And then will come your miraculous resurrection --
-- "oh, no, Officer, I'm very much alive -- just a joke to beat my husband at his own clever game -- What? What do you mean he's dead? It's all my fault, I may as well have killed him myself!"
"But you didn't, Ma'am. We have all these witnesses that saw..." well, whoever it ends up being that finally shoots him --
-- the James Dean wannabe with the hair trigger --
-- or might turn out to be -- very big surprise -- that Jenzen girl. The little bitch has the right stuff. She nearly put a bullet in Price right after your "demise."
So what stopped her?
It's complicated. But don't worry --
-- there's already been way too many complications for a very simple plan. You ever find out what happened to Melissa Marr?
Not yet.
So we don't even know if she's alive or dead --
-- Price killed her, there's no other explanation --
-- there's plenty: for all we know, Steven's got her spying on us right now --
-- bullshit --
-- the whole thing is falling apart! Blackburn starts stroking her, trying to calm her.
It's not, baby. Just a matter of minutes now, before somebody pulls the trigger --
-- but nobody has yet, Donald. They just haven't been brought to that breaking point. They have to believe proof-positive that their lives are in danger.
How much more do they need than your death at his hands?
But they didn't see it happen, they still have doubts. What we need is another body, and Steven's bloody hands right next to it!
And how the hell are we going to do that?

Okay: this may sound crazy, but -- -- and in one savage blur of motion, Evelyn drives Blackburn's scalpel right into his chest! Blackburn just stands there motionless, looking at her confused. She clears up any gray areas: thrusting deep an yanking down, gutting him like he's a trout.
Eddie trots into the room, carrying the thick base of a wrought-iron floor lamp. To Sara:
This is the best we're gonna do.
It'll have to do. They start out of the room. Watson Pritchett remains moro sitting in his chair.
You coming, or are you waiting for Blackburn?
Blackburn's dead.
Excuse me?
He would have been back by now. Beat. Eddie and Sara look at each other: nahhhh. And then
Hey: Dr. Blackburn...? Nothing in response. Sara grabs Pritchett and they head f the basement.
